alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 8:58PM CDT until March 26 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River at Poplar Bluff .The Black River at Poplar Bluff has reached minor flood stage and is cresting near 16.1 feet. The river will begin a quick drop... falling below flood stage late tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. If the water continues to rise, Hillcrest Park will be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
